metadata.ttm:title: Point of Contact Information
metadata.ttm:desc: Multiple Points of Contact may be designated in the Points of Contact Information Template. For some organizations, it may be advantageous to designate separate Points of Contact for specialized roles, such as Marketing and Contract Administration.

div.p: The "Point of Contact Information" screen
requires you to add the contact information for
people associated with your contract.
Note the drop down menu under "Point of Contact
Information."
Although only one Contract Administrator is required,
a best practice is to designate two or more.
Having multiple administrators reduces the
risk of costly lag time in the event that one
administrator is unable to perform his/her duties.
A contract administrator can be either Domestic or
Overseas.
You can also identify individuals specifically
responsible for marketing and for management of your
contract's Industrial Funding Fee.
It is recommended that you begin with the "Contract
Administrator."
Select this option from the drop down menu, again
indicating whether that person is located
domestically or Overseas, and click "Add Point of
Contact Details" when you're ready to move
forward.
On the Contact Information Screen, note the fields
designated with a red asterisk.
These are mandatory fields which must be completed.
Begin with the individual's "Name" and
"Title.
"You will also need to enter the "address" of the
person for whom you are entering information.
Note that the address and phone information should
identify where the person works, not where that
person lives.
Indicate the street address and the city in
the free form text boxes.
If the person is located domestically, select the
state from the drop down menu; if internationally
based, enter the country name in the free form
"text box."
Enter the person's "zip or postal code."
Select the appropriate country from the "drop
down menu."
Note that United States is at the top of the list.
Enter the person's "phone" and "fax number."
As well as the person's "e-mail address."
Note the "DUNS number text field."
This could be the same DUNS associated with your
company or, in the case of some larger businesses, a
different DUNS signifying a separate branch or
division within your overall company structure.
Click the "Add Point of Contact Information"
button You will see new Point of Contact added to
your list with the ability to "Edit" or "Delete" the
individual.
Continue adding the necessary points of
contact to your Offer.
When you are finished adding Points of Contact
Information, click "Back to Solicitation Clauses"
to move on.
